item.title: Riverfront Adirondack Mtns - Fall Retreat (Wells, NY) $500 2bd
item.description:
Beautiful scenery awaits you in this A frame cabin in the Adirondack Mountains. The house is located on the West Branch of the Sacandaga River with lovely views from the dining room table and oversized deck!

Our A frame Cabin sleeps 5, with two doubles and one twin bed. Our home away from home has all the amenities you would need for your family to relax together in a beautiful location. The house is located on a dead end road with ATV trails (snowmobile in winter) and roads in the area allow these vehicles.

Gas grill provided, outdoor picnic table seats 8, Adirondack chairs and a fire place for roasting smores! Kitchen is fully equipped.

We are 15 minutes south of Speculator (8 North) and about a 1 hr 30 minute drive from the Albany and Lake George area. Saratoga is a one hour drive. The river is shallow and safe for wading. We set up our chairs right in the water or sit on a rock and let the water run over our shoulders in our "natural hot tub". Fishing is great here, they stock the river about a mile upstream every Spring! We are a ten minute ride to the Northville Lake Placid Trail where you can take day hikes or walk across the suspension bridge. We are minutes away from Lake Algonquin and border state land.

Weekend rates are available please inquire

item.title: PENTHOUSE SUITE in Heart of the City (Midtown) $58 3bd
item.description:
$58 / 3BR PENTHOUSE SUITE in Heart of the City

Apartment does not come with a toilet, kitchen or electricity.

If you are reading this, yes it is a scam.

IF YOU AGREE WITH WHAT I'VE SAID, FEEL FREE TO COPY AND PASTE THIS IN TO YOUR OWN AD.

This price is not possible in Manhattan.

There are legitimate vacation rentals on Craig's list but you're looking for cheap. They're looking for stupid. Don't be stupid.

Here are some simple ways to avoid scams and find real vacation rentals in Manhattan:

- If the person put's their e-mail address in ad here on Craig's List then it's fake. They do it multiple times then it's REALLY FAKE!. Look their address up on Facebook and make sure they have a active account. It's really simple and it's really a great background check. See what other people have written on their wall and how many friends they have.

- Always request a telephone number. In most cases they will be to a voicemail box.
(*Note: Never use your own home number or cell phone to call that number).
Google has an application that will allow free calls from your computer to within the US: http://www.google.com/chat/voice/

- Always request a face to face meeting.

- NEVER SEND FUNDS without seeing the place first.

- Find someone in the City already to check it out. It's a large city and you must know someone here already.
(If you know them really well perhaps they can spot you the deposit check if things check out). Pay them back or take them out to dinner if things work out.

- If anyone uses the term "Voucher or Receipt" along with "Doorman" and "Keys" it's a scam

- All high end buildings in New York have a doorman. All doormen are unionized and they have universal security rules. The rules require the owner of the apartment to fill out a card in order for any keys to be released. That signature card has to be on file.

- If possible use a separate e-mail account and phone for contacting possible "Vacation Rentals" so they don't have your personal information.

Contact me if you have any additional questions, but remember I could be a scammer too.

Safe travels.

Located a shore walk away from Banner Hill School of Fine Arts & Woodworking and only minutes from downhill and cross country skiing, ice skating, horseback riding, scenic golf courses and hiking trails, fishing, whitewater rafting, and more.

In the town of Windham you will find a variety of restaurants, antique shops, concert halls, art galleries, wineries, theatres, and more. Year round seasonal beauty abounds (with the changing high colors of the foliage in the Autumn being an exceptional time of beauty).
